column5: Hey all.  So I went to LeBaron today at lunch and picked up a Wally Diver CD7 and a Rapala Deep Tail Dancer TDD11 for this weekend.  I have a spot in mind on the lake (20' to 30' drop off) so my intent was to cast to cover more water rather then troll.  Now, I was wondering how deep can I get these lures casting, waiting then reeling in?  Are the walleye still going shallow later in the day to feed?  I haven't been there in a few weeks...  I'll be hunting walleye and if lucky musky, thanks.  Geoff

You can get 9-15' casting a wally. You should be able to get a little more out of the dancer. If you fish very early mornings, late afternoons/early evenings or in low light conditions, you shouldn't ever need more depth than that.
clear water, go with the wally in Chartreuse/Gold or TDD11 in Bleeding Hot Olive?
